summary: Suspense accounts are meant to temporarily record transactions that require more research before they are permanently recorded. The Department of Defense has lacked internal controls over its suspense accounts for decades, leading to large balances and costly write-offs. The policies and procedures that DOD issued to address these accounts were insufficient, outdated, and inconsistently implemented. title: Department of Defense: Additional Actions to Improve Suspense Account Transactions Would Strengthen Financial Reporting
